00035 //
00036 // the following must not be macros if we are to prefix them
00037 // with std:: (they shouldn't be macros anyway...)
00038 //
00039 #ifdef ispunct
00040 #  undef ispunct
00041 #endif
00042 #ifdef isspace
00043 #  undef isspace
00044 #endif
00045 //
00046 // fix namespace problems:
00047 //
00048 #ifdef BOOST_NO_STDC_NAMESPACE
00049 namespace std{
00050  using ::ispunct;
00051  using ::isspace;
00052 }
00053 #endif

00055 namespace boost{

00057   //===========================================================================
00058   // The escaped_list_separator class. Which is a model of TokenizerFunction
00059   // An escaped list is a super-set of what is commonly known as a comma 
00060   // separated value (csv) list.It is separated into fields by a comma or 
00061   // other character. If the delimiting character is inside quotes, then it is
00062   // counted as a regular character.To allow for embedded quotes in a field,
00063   // there can be escape sequences using the \ much like C. 
00064   // The role of the comma, the quotation mark, and the escape 
00065   // character (backslash \), can be assigned to other characters.
00066 
00067   struct escaped_list_error : public std::runtime_error{
00068     escaped_list_error(const std::string& what):std::runtime_error(what) { }
00069   };
00070   
00071 
00072 // The out of the box GCC 2.95 on cygwin does not have a char_traits class.
00073 // MSVC does not like the following typename
00074 #if !defined(BOOST_MSVC) || BOOST_MSVC > 1300
00075   template <class Char, 
00076     class Traits = typename std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00077 #else
00078   template <class Char, 
00079     class Traits = std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00080 #endif
00081   class escaped_list_separator {
00082 
00083   private:
00084     typedef std::basic_string<Char,Traits> string_type;
00085     struct char_eq {
00086       Char e_;
00087       char_eq(Char e):e_(e) { }
00088       bool operator()(Char c) {
00089         return Traits::eq(e_,c);
00090       }
00091     };
00092     string_type  escape_;
00093     string_type  c_;
00094     string_type  quote_;      
00095     bool last_;
00096 
00097     bool is_escape(Char e) {
00098       char_eq f(e);
00099       return std::find_if(escape_.begin(),escape_.end(),f)!=escape_.end();
00100     }
00101     bool is_c(Char e) {
00102       char_eq f(e);
00103       return std::find_if(c_.begin(),c_.end(),f)!=c_.end();
00104     }
00105     bool is_quote(Char e) {
00106       char_eq f(e);
00107       return std::find_if(quote_.begin(),quote_.end(),f)!=quote_.end();
00108     }
00109     template <typename iterator, typename Token>
00110     void do_escape(iterator& next,iterator end,Token& tok) {
00111       if (++next == end)
00112         throw escaped_list_error(std::string("cannot end with escape"));
00113       if (Traits::eq(*next,'n')) {
00114         tok+='\n';
00115         return;
00116       }
00117       else if (is_quote(*next)) {
00118         tok+=*next;
00119         return;
00120       }
00121       else if (is_c(*next)) {
00122         tok+=*next;
00123         return;
00124       }
00125       else if (is_escape(*next)) {
00126         tok+=*next;
00127         return;
00128       }
00129       else
00130         throw escaped_list_error(std::string("unknown escape sequence"));
00131     }
00132 
00133     public:
00134     
00135     explicit escaped_list_separator(Char  e = '\\',
00136                                     Char c = ',',Char  q = '\"')
00137       : escape_(1,e), c_(1,c), quote_(1,q), last_(false) { }
00138     
00139     escaped_list_separator(string_type e, string_type c, string_type q)
00140       : escape_(e), c_(c), quote_(q), last_(false) { }
00141     
00142     void reset() {last_=false;}
00143 
00144     template <typename InputIterator, typename Token>
00145     bool operator()(InputIterator& next,InputIterator end,Token& tok) {
00146       bool bInQuote = false;
00147       tok = Token();
00148       
00149       if (next == end) {
00150         if (last_) {
00151           last_ = false;
00152           return true;
00153         }
00154         else
00155           return false;
00156       }
00157       last_ = false;
00158       for (;next != end;++next) {
00159         if (is_escape(*next)) {
00160           do_escape(next,end,tok);
00161         }
00162         else if (is_c(*next)) {
00163           if (!bInQuote) {
00164             // If we are not in quote, then we are done
00165             ++next;
00166             // The last character was a c, that means there is
00167             // 1 more blank field
00168             last_ = true; 
00169             return true;
00170           }
00171           else tok+=*next;
00172         }
00173         else if (is_quote(*next)) {
00174           bInQuote=!bInQuote;
00175         }
00176         else {
00177           tok += *next;
00178         }
00179       }
00180       return true;
00181     }
00182   };
00183

00185   //===========================================================================
00186   // The offset_separator class, which is a model of TokenizerFunction.
00187   // Offset breaks a string into tokens based on a range of offsets
00188 
00189   class offset_separator {
00190   private:
00191 
00192     std::vector<int> offsets_;
00193     unsigned int current_offset_;
00194     bool wrap_offsets_;
00195     bool return_partial_last_;
00196     
00197   public:
00198     template <typename Iter>
00199     offset_separator(Iter begin, Iter end, bool wrap_offsets = true,
00200                      bool return_partial_last = true)
00201       : offsets_(begin,end), current_offset_(0),
00202         wrap_offsets_(wrap_offsets),
00203         return_partial_last_(return_partial_last) { }
00204    
00205     offset_separator()
00206       : offsets_(1,1), current_offset_(),
00207         wrap_offsets_(true), return_partial_last_(true) { }
00208 
00209     void reset() {
00210       current_offset_ = 0;
00211     }
00212 
00213     template <typename InputIterator, typename Token>
00214     bool operator()(InputIterator& next, InputIterator end, Token& tok)
00215     {
00216       assert(!offsets_.empty());
00217     
00218       tok = Token();
00219       
00220       if (next == end)
00221         return false;
00222 
00223       if (current_offset_ == offsets_.size()){
00224         if (wrap_offsets_)
00225           current_offset_=0;
00226         else
00227           return false;
00228       }
00229       int c = offsets_[current_offset_];
00230       int i = 0;
00231       for (; i < c; ++i) {
00232         if (next == end)break;
00233         tok+=*next++;
00234       }
00235     
00236       if (!return_partial_last_)
00237         if (i < (c-1) )
00238           return false;
00239       
00240       ++current_offset_;
00241       return true;
00242     }
00243   };
00244 
00245 
00246   //===========================================================================
00247   // The char_separator class breaks a sequence of characters into
00248   // tokens based on the character delimiters (very much like bad old
00249   // strtok). A delimiter character can either be kept or dropped. A
00250   // kept delimiter shows up as an output token, whereas a dropped
00251   // delimiter does not.
00252 
00253   // This class replaces the char_delimiters_separator class. The
00254   // constructor for the char_delimiters_separator class was too
00255   // confusing and needed to be deprecated. However, because of the
00256   // default arguments to the constructor, adding the new constructor
00257   // would cause ambiguity, so instead I deprecated the whole class.
00258   // The implementation of the class was also simplified considerably.
00259 
00260   enum empty_token_policy { drop_empty_tokens, keep_empty_tokens };
00261 
00262   // The out of the box GCC 2.95 on cygwin does not have a char_traits class.
00263 #if !defined(BOOST_MSVC) || BOOST_MSVC > 1300
00264   template <typename Char, 
00265     typename Traits = typename std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00266 #else
00267   template <typename Char, 
00268     typename Traits = std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00269 #endif
00270   class char_separator
00271   {
00272     typedef std::basic_string<Char,Traits> string_type;
00273   public:
00274     explicit 
00275     char_separator(const Char* dropped_delims,
00276                    const Char* kept_delims = 0,
00277                    empty_token_policy empty_tokens = drop_empty_tokens)
00278       : m_dropped_delims(dropped_delims),
00279         m_use_ispunct(false),
00280         m_use_isspace(false),
00281         m_empty_tokens(empty_tokens),
00282         m_output_done(false)
00283     {
00284       // Borland workaround
00285       if (kept_delims)
00286         m_kept_delims = kept_delims;
00287     }
00288 
00289                 // use ispunct() for kept delimiters and isspace for dropped.
00290     explicit
00291     char_separator()
00292       : m_use_ispunct(true), 
00293         m_use_isspace(true), 
00294         m_empty_tokens(drop_empty_tokens) { }
00295 
00296     void reset() { }
00297 
00298     template <typename InputIterator, typename Token>
00299     bool operator()(InputIterator& next, InputIterator end, Token& tok)
00300     {
00301       tok = Token();
00302 
00303       // skip past all dropped_delims
00304       if (m_empty_tokens == drop_empty_tokens)
00305         for (; next != end  && is_dropped(*next); ++next)
00306           { }
00307       
00308       if (m_empty_tokens == drop_empty_tokens) {
00309 
00310         if (next == end)
00311           return false;
00312 
00313         // if we are on a kept_delims move past it and stop
00314         if (is_kept(*next)) {
00315           tok += *next;
00316           ++next;
00317         } else
00318           // append all the non delim characters
00319           for (; next != end && !is_dropped(*next) && !is_kept(*next); ++next)
00320             tok += *next;
00321       } 
00322       else { // m_empty_tokens == keep_empty_tokens
00323         
00324         // Handle empty token at the end
00325         if (next == end){
00326           if (m_output_done == false) {
00327             m_output_done = true;
00328             return true;
00329           } else
00330             return false;
00331         }
00332         if (is_kept(*next)) {
00333           if (m_output_done == false)
00334             m_output_done = true;
00335           else {
00336             tok += *next;
00337             ++next;
00338             m_output_done = false;
00339           }
00340         } 
00341         else if (m_output_done == false && is_dropped(*next)) {
00342           m_output_done = true;
00343         } 
00344         else {
00345           if (is_dropped(*next))
00346             ++next;
00347           for (; next != end && !is_dropped(*next) && !is_kept(*next); ++next)
00348             tok += *next;
00349           m_output_done = true;
00350         }
00351       }
00352       return true;
00353     }
00354 
00355   private:
00356     string_type m_kept_delims;
00357     string_type m_dropped_delims;
00358     bool m_use_ispunct;
00359     bool m_use_isspace;
00360     empty_token_policy m_empty_tokens;
00361     bool m_output_done;
00362     
00363     bool is_kept(Char E) const
00364     {  
00365       if (m_kept_delims.length())
00366         return m_kept_delims.find(E) != string_type::npos;
00367       else if (m_use_ispunct) {
00368         return std::ispunct(E) != 0;
00369       } else
00370         return false;
00371     }
00372     bool is_dropped(Char E) const
00373     {
00374       if (m_dropped_delims.length())
00375         return m_dropped_delims.find(E) != string_type::npos;
00376       else if (m_use_isspace) {
00377         return std::isspace(E) != 0;
00378       } else
00379         return false;
00380     }
00381   };
00382 
00383   //===========================================================================
00384   // The following class is DEPRECATED, use class char_separators instead.
00385   //
00386   // The char_delimiters_separator class, which is a model of
00387   // TokenizerFunction.  char_delimiters_separator breaks a string
00388   // into tokens based on character delimiters. There are 2 types of
00389   // delimiters. returnable delimiters can be returned as
00390   // tokens. These are often punctuation. nonreturnable delimiters
00391   // cannot be returned as tokens. These are often whitespace
00392 
00393   // The out of the box GCC 2.95 on cygwin does not have a char_traits class.
00394 #if !defined(BOOST_MSVC) || BOOST_MSVC > 1300
00395   template <class Char, 
00396     class Traits = typename std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00397 #else
00398   template <class Char, 
00399     class Traits = std::basic_string<Char>::traits_type >
00400 #endif
00401   class char_delimiters_separator {
00402   private:  
00403 
00404     typedef std::basic_string<Char,Traits> string_type;
00405     string_type returnable_;
00406     string_type nonreturnable_;
00407     bool return_delims_;
00408     bool no_ispunct_;
00409     bool no_isspace_;
00410     
00411     bool is_ret(Char E)const
00412     {  
00413       if (returnable_.length())
00414         return  returnable_.find(E) != string_type::npos;
00415       else{
00416         if (no_ispunct_) {return false;}
00417         else{
00418           int r = std::ispunct(E);
00419           return r != 0;
00420         }
00421       }
00422     }
00423     bool is_nonret(Char E)const
00424     {
00425       if (nonreturnable_.length())
00426         return  nonreturnable_.find(E) != string_type::npos;
00427       else{
00428         if (no_isspace_) {return false;}
00429         else{
00430           int r = std::isspace(E);
00431           return r != 0;
00432         }
00433       }
00434     }
00435     
00436   public:
00437     explicit char_delimiters_separator(bool return_delims = false, 
00438                                        const Char* returnable = 0,
00439                                        const Char* nonreturnable = 0)
00440       : returnable_(returnable ? returnable : string_type().c_str()),
00441         nonreturnable_(nonreturnable ? nonreturnable:string_type().c_str()),
00442         return_delims_(return_delims), no_ispunct_(returnable!=0),
00443         no_isspace_(nonreturnable!=0) { }
00444     
00445     void reset() { }
00446 
00447   public:
00448 
00449      template <typename InputIterator, typename Token>
00450      bool operator()(InputIterator& next, InputIterator end,Token& tok) {
00451      tok = Token();
00452      
00453      // skip past all nonreturnable delims
00454      // skip past the returnable only if we are not returning delims
00455      for (;next!=end && ( is_nonret(*next) || (is_ret(*next) 
00456        && !return_delims_ ) );++next) { }
00457      
00458      if (next == end) {
00459        return false;
00460      }
00461      
00462      // if we are to return delims and we are one a returnable one
00463      // move past it and stop
00464      if (is_ret(*next) && return_delims_) {
00465        tok+=*next;
00466        ++next;
00467      }
00468      else
00469        // append all the non delim characters
00470        for (;next!=end && !is_nonret(*next) && !is_ret(*next);++next)
00471          tok+=*next;
00472        
00473        
00474      return true;
00475    }
00476   };
00477
